image.altText: Graphics image of officer wearing uniform wearing a face mask and behind him a police vehicle and flag with the blue line in it

props.synopsis: The former police supervisor of Zachary Rolfe publicly displayed a symbol linked to far-right extremist groups on his Facebook page until last week, when the ABC notified his bosses.

title.children: Police officer with 'racist attitudes' displayed symbol linked to white supremacists

image.altText: A photo of a police officer in official uniform, standing in an outback landscape as the sun sets behind him.

props.synopsis:
A doctor who treated a constable that later took his own life defends his treatment plan to a coronial inquest, while describing him as a "gentle, beautiful man".

title.children: GP blames 'rotten' police culture for constable's death

image.altText: A court sketch of a man looking off to the side.

props.synopsis: The helicopter pilot involved in the crash that killed Chris "Willow" Wilson tells the Northern Territory Supreme Court that he "intentionally disconnected" Netflix star Matt Wright before Mr Wilson fell 25 metres to his death.

title.children: Pilot shares frustrations over crash that took his ability to walk

props.synopsis: Ranger groups and volunteer firefighters are working hard to finish up their controlled burns before the bushfire season begins in earnest. But their efforts are stymied by what they say is a new level of illegally dumped rubbish in the bush.

title.children: Dumped rubbish slows down controlled burns before bushfire season

image.altText: Bottles of wine on a store shelf.

props.synopsis: People's Alcohol Action Coalition are calling on the two major liquor outlets to sign up to the Alice Springs Liquor Accord's voluntary $1.30 per standard drink alcohol measure six months after the Northern Territory government scrapped the controversial legislation.

title.children: Liquorland, BWS 'dragging feet' on minimum alcohol price, action group says

image.altText: A close up of an elderly woman with glasses and white hair.

props.synopsis: Lynette Stewart has hid in bushes and locked herself in rooms to escape the terrifying treatment of a family member. Her experience is why advocates are calling for proper elder abuse legislation.

title.children: Grandmother endures family abuse in a place with few protections for her

image.altText: A group of people holding signs and placards standing in scrubland near a road.

props.synopsis: Pro-Palestinian protesters in outback Australia call the federal government's announcement "performative" and say they have concerns Israel could use intelligence gathered on Australian soil in its attacks on Gaza.

title.children: Pine Gap protesters reject prime minister's recognition of Palestine

image.altText: James Crisp x

props.synopsis: A father and son were accused of preying on victims at a Catholic boarding school but only one was charged. Â Now they are both behind bars.

title.children: Father and son jailed decades after role in alleged school paedophile ring

image.altText: A children's toy bear laying sideways on a floor.

props.synopsis: A string of regulatory failings has seen a Victorian childcare worker retain a legal clearance to work with children â despite being blacklisted from the industry after an investigation found he was grooming toddlers.

title.children: Worker sacked for 'grooming' toddlers retains Working with Children Check

image.altText: Kitchen worker uses tongs in a pub kitchen in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The peak union group says a shorter work week would improve productivity and reduce burnout, adding workers should also be able to share in the spoils of the expected artificial intelligence boom.

title.children: Peak union group says it's time for a shorter work week

props.synopsis: Bullsbrook residents whose homes are being connected to scheme water after groundwater supplies were contaminated with PFAS say the Department of Defence won't replace their pipes and water systems.Â

title.children: Residents' row with Defence continues over 'forever' chemicals near Perth

image.altText: A woman wearing a teal headdress is crying with tears rolling from her eyes

props.synopsis: The Independent Investigative Mechanism for Myanmar said victims were subject to beatings, electric shocks, sexual violence, strangulation and other forms of torture.

title.children: Children illegally detained, tortured in Myanmar, UN investigator finds

image.altText: A woman walks towards a bright light on a dark day

props.synopsis: Patients and their families navigating the mental health system in regional NSW say critical gaps in care are leading to deadly consequences for people with complex needs.

title.children: Patients 'left to fend for themselves' amid mental health crisis in NSW

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says he is seeking "big reform" from next week's productivity roundtable after the Reserve Bank downgrades its growth forecasts. Follow live.

image.altText: A crowd of people surround a truck, some are climbing on the truck.

props.synopsis: A joint statement, signed by Foreign Minister Penny Wong, condemns the politicisation of aid and says "urgent action is needed now to halt and reverse starvation" in Gaza.Â

title.children: Australia and allies say Gaza's aid crisis has reached 'unimaginable levels'

image.altText: An image of a man with glasses and grey hair inset against an emergency department sign and a hospital building.

props.synopsis: A coroner rules a dementia patient who disappeared from a regional Queensland hospital in 2023, never to be seen again, died from dehydration. It prompted security changes, but did not stop similar incidents.

title.children: Dementia patient walks out of hospital never to be seen again

image.altText: A selfie of a woman with long brown hair in a cream shirt, smiling with closed lips.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged with two counts of murder after police found the bodies of Athena Georgopoulos and Andrew Gunn in a unit in Melbourne's south-east on Monday night.

title.children: Man charged over deaths of man and woman in Mount Waverley

image.altText: A large billboard with Russian writing on it is seen near a local road on an overcast day.

props.synopsis: You don't have to look far in Russia to find hypotheses as to why Alaska is in the wrong hands. Whether Moscow could ever rule it again depends on who you talk to.

title.children: To understand Russia's 'Alaska myth', there's a song that could help

image.altText: A man poses in a photo.

props.synopsis: A man was set to receive $12,000 for directing an arson attack on a Jewish business in Sydney's east last year, court documents allege.

title.children: Court documents allege $12k payment for arson attack in Jewish business

image.altText: Dewald Brevis walks off the field carrying his bat and his helmet

props.synopsis: Emerging star Dewald Brevis smashes a record 125 not out in 56 balls to set up a 53-run victory for South Africa and level the T20 series with Australia.

title.children: South Africa's next great batting hope blows Australia away with record T20 knock

image.altText: A sandstone cliff line landslide with rocks at the bottom.

props.synopsis: One of the largest Blue Mountains rockfalls in recent years shaves off two notorious climbing routes that were never repeated after the first climbers established them.Â

title.children: Carne Wall landslide wipes out notoriously difficult Blue Mountain climbs

image.altText: A woman fills out a ballot.

props.synopsis: Five months on from Western Australia's problem-plagued state election, organisers have been given a clear road map to avoid the same mistakes in four years' time.

title.children: How a $12 million shortfall spiralled into a problem-plagued WA election

image.altText: Woman poses for photo, leaning against a black fence at a racecourse

props.synopsis: The announcement of funding being ended for Tasmania's greyhound racing industry has left the people who work in it "filthy, angry", a trainer says â with special mention made of the Liberal state premier.

title.children: Greyhound industry 'filthy and angry' over Tasmanian ban

image.altText: A close up photo of Donald Trump. He his tilting his head and looking ahead with a slight frown.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has announced a federal takeover of Washington DC's police force, saying the city is "becoming a situation of complete and total lawlessness". But is this true?

title.children: Trump says he must 'rescue' Washington DC from crime. How bad is it?

image.altText: A woman wearing a denim jacket sitting at a desk with a microphone.

props.synopsis: Former member of the Australian National University council Liz Allen has used a Senate inquiry investigating university governance to allege Chancellor Julie Bishop harassed, bullied, and threatened her.

title.children: Julie Bishop accused of bullying by ANU staff member, senate inquiry hears

image.altText: The Brisbane River at Albion, with flooding around buildings on its banks, is seen from above.

props.synopsis: In its latest modelling, council finds 10,129 more properties across Brisbane are now at risk of creek and waterway flooding.

title.children: More than 10,000 Brisbane properties to be added to flood maps

image.altText: Young girl in bee suit with a bee on finger.

props.synopsis: A couple who started a business to help their daughter's eczema now manage 450 hives and run inclusive beekeeping programs for schools and NDIS participants.

title.children: NDIS-registered beekeeping program has school students buzzing

image.altText: A pharmacist speaks to a patient in a small room.

props.synopsis: The peak national body for community pharmacists wants to its members take on more responsibilities for community care in an 'ambitious' plan, but the initiative also has its critics.

title.children: 'Ambitious' plan could see 80pc of pharmacists diagnose health conditions

image.altText: A dog toy that looks like a monkey and a red ball in the foreground of a dog house outside. It feels moody.

props.synopsis: Victim-survivors of domestic violence say the bond they share with their pets is weaponised as a form of coercive control, as legal experts push for animal abuse to be recognised under the law.Â

title.children: DV prevention advocates want animal abuse defined in SA's coercive control laws

image.altText: GettyImages-97340442

props.synopsis: It was a season that would go down in history as one of the great AFL performances. Now, the five men who played for the Blues for the first time in 1995 tell their stories of that incredible year.

title.children: How five debuts help tell the story of Carlton's remarkable 1995 season

image.altText: Liverpool Hospital sign to emergency

props.synopsis: Two overstretched hospitals in south-west Sydney have consistently ranked "significantly lower" than average in a survey of patient satisfaction, according to new data released by the Bureau of Health Information.

title.children: New data reveals two south-west Sydney hospitals rank lower than average

image.altText: Max and berts burnt

props.synopsis: Two heritage huts in the Namadgi National Park will not be rebuilt in an ACT government backflip, which experts say goes against heritage guidance and has left family and friends involved feeling betrayed.

title.children: 'Like a gravestone': The heritage huts that won't rise again

props.synopsis: Like in the AFL, Tasmanian politics is in its own trade week â and at the moment, the protracted negotiations are between Labor and the Greens.

title.children: Tasmanian Labor have so far failed to sway the Greens, and it's blown up on them
